The summit consists of a cluster of late-Pleistocene to Holocene lava domes that were associated with thick block-lava flows on the northern and eastern flanks and extensive pyroclastic-flow deposits.
The summit contains a funnel-shaped crater 200-300 m deep.
Holocene activity has included explosive eruptions ranging in size from moderate to plinian.
The last major eruption took place about 3600 years ago.
Lava dome growth has produced block-and-ash flows that traveled primarily to the NE and SE.
